SEARCH
Package com.bhoffpauir.blisp.lib

Class Lambda

java.lang.Object
com.bhoffpauir.blisp.lib.Atom<Procedure>
com.bhoffpauir.blisp.lib.Lambda
public class Lambda extends Atom<Procedure>
Represents a Lambda function in blisp.

This class encapsulates a lambda function, which includes the function's parameters, body, and the environment in which it was defined (known as the closure). Lambdas can be invoked with the call(Evaluator, List) method, which creates a new environment for the function execution and evaluates the lambda body in this environment.

Lambdas are a fundamental part of blisp, enabling functional programming features like closures.

See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Lambda

      public Lambda(List<SymbolAtom> parameters, ListAtom body, Environment parentEnv)
      Constructs a lambda with the given parameters, body, and parent environment.

      The parentEnv is the environment in which this lambda was created, and it is used as the parent scope during lambda execution.

      Parameters:
      parameters - A list of SymbolAtom representing the parameter names for this lambda.
      body - The body of the lambda, represented by a ListAtom containing the expressions to execute.
      parentEnv - The environment where the lambda was defined, providing scope for closures.

  • Method Details

    • call

      public Object call(Evaluator evaluator, List<Object> args)
      Calls this lambda with the provided arguments, using the given evaluator.

      This method creates a new environment for the lambda invocation, binds the argument values to the parameter names, and evaluates the lambda body in this environment. The lambda inherits from the closure's environment where it was originally defined.

      Parameters:
      evaluator - The evaluator used to evaluate the body of the lambda.
      args - A list of argument values to pass to the lambda. The size of this list must match the number of parameters.
      Returns:
      The result of evaluating the lambda body.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the number of arguments does not match the number of parameters.

    • getRegexPattern

      public Pattern getRegexPattern()
      Throws an UnsupportedOperationException as regular expressions do not apply to lambdas.
      Specified by:
      getRegexPattern in class Atom<Procedure>
      Returns:
      This method does not return anything as it throws an exception.
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - when called.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this lambda, displaying its parameters and body.

      If extended printing is enabled, more detailed information can be included (e.g., environment), but in its basic form, it lists the parameters and body of the lambda.

      Specified by:
      toString in class Atom<Procedure>
      Returns:
      A string describing the lambda function.
